channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Reject the Numbing of America
item.description: The Sacred Heart and the presidential election.

item.title: Democrat digs in as transgender sports comments spur backlash: 'This is the problem with Democrats'
item.description: Rep. Seth Moulton's comments last week about trans issues, women's athletics, and Democrats appearing out of touch with voters prompted furious denunc...

item.title: Donald Trump Doesn’t Need Recess Appointments
item.description: And the Senate shouldn’t abandon its ‘advice and consent’ role.

item.title: Who could run to replace Stefanik in the House?
item.description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul must call a special election to fill Rep. Elise Stefanik's House seat once she becomes U.S. ambassador to the United Nation...

item.title: Voters Decided Democrats Are The Biggest Threat To Democracy
item.description: The majority of Americans now see that the biggest threat to our republic is the Democratic Party that runs most of the country.

item.title: Democrat Ruben Gallego wins Arizona U.S. Senate race, defeating Republican Kari Lake
item.description: Democrat Ruben Gallego has been elected Arizona's first Latino U.S. senator, defeating Republican Kari Lake and preventing Republicans from further pa...

item.title: How To Make Legislatures Stop Working For Special Interests And Start Working For The People
item.description: Decentralizing power in the legislature is necessary if the people are to take back control of government from lobbyists and bureaucrats.

item.title: Trump tells world leader election gives him a 'very big mandate'
item.description: President-elect Trump says his victory "gives me a very big mandate to do things properly" in phone call with Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto.

item.title: California Republican congressman concedes competitive race to Democratic challenger
item.description: Rep. Mike Garcia, R-Calif., conceded his race to Democratic challenger George Whitesides on Monday night.

item.title: Big Pharma And Big Food Are Shaking In Their Boots At A Second Trump Era
item.description: The incoming Trump administration poses a major threat to the unholy alliance between pharmaceutical giants and Big Agriculture.

item.title: J. D. Vance Is Walking a Historically Unusual Path
item.description: There are not many usable precedents for what J. D. Vance can do with a one-term vice presidency.

item.title: Newly Minted ‘Election Denier’ Sen. Bob Casey Refuses To Accept Loss
item.description: Sen. Casey took a break from solving crime, hunger, and war to spend time impeaching Donald Trump for asking questions about the 2020 election.

item.title: Schumer invites McCormick, Gallego to new-senator orientation
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer has invited Dave McCormick and Ruben Gallego to orientation after initially excluding both from the event.

item.title: Trump to pick Gov. Kristi Noem to lead Homeland Security
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to select South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem to lead the Department of Homeland Security, naming a loyal ally to c...

item.title: Who could replace Elise Stefanik in House GOP leadership? What we know
item.description: Reps. Kat Cammack, Lisa McClain and Erin Houchin are all running to succeed Rep. Elise Stefanik in Wednesday's leadership elections.

item.title: Jack Smith Ditching His Case Against Trump Is Not A Concession, It’s A Coverup
item.description: This move marks yet another self-serving, calculated maneuver, a legal sleight-of-hand designed to protect reputations.

item.title: New York judge set to decide whether to dismiss Trump's criminal conviction
item.description: A New York judge will decide Tuesday whether to dismiss President-elect Donald Trump's felony conviction in Manhattan in light of the Supreme Court de...

item.title: Fracking Is Key in the Keystone State — in 2024 and Beyond
item.description: It has fundamentally transformed the United States, and it influenced this election cycle.

item.title: Students Lose, Teachers’ Unions Win in Massachusetts Election
item.description: The state’s vote to abolish its high-school exit exam keeps us from knowing how well they’re educating students — which is just how teachers’ unions l...

item.title: After standoff, Chuck Schumer invites Sen.-elect David McCormick to Senate orientation
item.description: Senate Democratic Majority Leader Charles E. Schumer is inviting Sen.-elect David McCormick to an orientation session for new members, reversing his e...
